title: (x) geometric sans "Café" with single storey "a" - ITC Avant Garde Gothic {Mo Yo (self), Stephen}
content:
What typeface is this?

And what is the typography term for this kind of ‘a’ as opposed to the usuall ‘teapot’ open shape ‘a’?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [cafe.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=cafe.gif) | 2.45 KB |
author: moyo

comments.content: Many call it a single-story a.
And what is the typeface? ITC Avant Gothic Demi is close but not exact.

How old is the sample? It could be the photo type version of [ITC Avant Garde Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111101641/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.7.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=74&sampleText=Caf%C3%A9&sampleSize=96).

“Teapot”?! Hey, that’s pretty cool. Where did you get that?  
I call them monocular and binocular.

hhp
